description: '''Jo Bang-heon''' ({{Korean|hangul=조방헌}}; born February 16, 1953), better known by his stage name, '''Tae Jin-ah''' ({{Korean|hangul=태진아|labels=no}}), is a South Korean [[Trot (music)|trot]] singer and entertainer. He debuted in 1973 with the song, "My Heart Express Train," and rose to fame soon after with the song, "Memory of a Blue Hill." Since 2002, he has hosted a radio program on [[KBS Radio 2]] called the ''Tae Jin Ah Show Show Show.''  He often appears on the [[Korean Broadcasting System|KBS]] 1TV '[[Golden Oldies (TV program)|Golden Oldies]]({{langx|ko|가요무대}})'.
